elements.title: Frances "the Shape" Vorne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a photograph of Frances "the Shape" Vorne wearing a swimsuit made from remnants of a captured Nazi parachute (pictured) was one of the most sought-after pin-ups of World War II?

elements.title: Blood Pit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the play-by-email game Blood Pit was so complex that even its programmer had trouble winning?

elements.title: José Cobo Cano (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that José Cobo Cano compared officiating same-sex marriages to celebrating the Eucharist with Coca-Cola?

elements.title: Eternal Blue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Eternal Blue, a metalcore album, was inspired in part by 1980s pop music?

elements.title: Maisi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Loud LDN co-founder Maisi came joint last in the 2022 Maldon mud race, behind a naked runner who had been forced to start after everyone else?

elements.title: 1976 Spring Hill shooting (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the perpetrator of the 1976 Spring Hill shooting allegedly committed the attack in a rage after being denied membership to a model plane club?

elements.title: Wendy McMahon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that CBS News and Stations president Wendy McMahon helped bring local evening news back to the network's Detroit station after 20 years?

elements.title: dwarf merry widow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the dwarf merry widow is not very brave?
